incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Start time : 05/10/2023 03:15 UTC Service impact : Servers in the racks 46E11, 46E12, and 46E13 are no longer reachable. Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

Start time : 05/10/2023 07:00 UTC End time : 05/10/2023 09:00 UTC Service impact : None Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a maintenance operation on Vrack network equipment.

Start time : 09/10/2023 04:00 UTC End time : 09/10/2023 05:00 UTC Service impact : Some servers are unreachable. Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be replacing network equipment with defective ports.

Start time : 09/10/2023 12:30 UTC End time : 09/10/2023 14:30 UTC Service impact : Public and vRack networks will be unavailable for servers in rack 050811 during maintenance. Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a maintenance on a network equipment

Start time : 10/10/2023 04:30 UTC End time : 12/10/2023 13:00 UTC Service impact : During the maintenance, a restart of the server-side NFS daemon will be made. So a service interruption of less than a second may be observed Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to make NFSv4.1 automatically supported by default on all SSD-based NAS-HA over the current NFSv3. Some changes might be observed from cutomers side which are as follow: * For your future NAS-HA orders, NFSv4.1 will be used by default when mounting your file shares. If needed, you will be able to choose between v3 and v4.1 when mounting your shares using the mount utility. * For existing ones, it will depend on what you did initially: - If you didn't force NFSv3 when mounting your shares: NFSv4.1 will be applied if the server or the client service is restarted. You can decide to force NFSv3 using the same mount utility. - If you forced NFSv3 when mounting your shares: nothing will change, you will keep your original configuration.

scheduled_maintenances.name: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - End of Life Real Time Monitoring APIv6

incident_updates.body: Start time : 07/11/2023 09:30 UTC End time : 07/11/2023 10:00 UTC Service impact : The End of Life of Real Time Monitoring (RTM) for baremetal is scheduled for the 7th of November 2023. Few customers will be impacted (less than 10) and will stop be able to monitor their dedicated servers via the APIv6. This will impact APIv6 calls /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/statistics.

Start time : 09/10/2023 08:00 UTC End time : 10/10/2023 15:00 UTC Service impact : Lowered performance during maintenance Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, our teams will upgrade CEPH cluster in GRA.

Start time : 29/11/2023 21:00 UTC End time : 30/11/2023 00:00 UTC Service impact : None Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a version upgrade on multiple network equipment.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

incident_updates.body: Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

Start time: 03/10/2023 08:00 UTC End time: 03/11/2023 10:50 UTC Service impact: The Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) will no longer be available after 03/10/2023 Service improvement: The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) for all Baremetal products. Customers should start using the new Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer). The old Web interface is no longer present on the new version. Please follow this procedure to troubleshoot hardware problems: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-dedicated-servers-hardware-diagnostics?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0043506
